gee:asset_schema.name: CLOUDY_PIXEL_PERCENTAGE
gee:asset_schema.description: Granule-specific cloudy pixel percentage taken from the original metadata

gee:asset_schema.name: CLOUD_COVERAGE_ASSESSMENT
gee:asset_schema.description: Cloudy pixel percentage for the whole archive that contains this granule. Taken from the original metadata

gee:asset_schema.name: PRODUCT_ID
gee:asset_schema.description: The full id of the original Sentinel-2 product

gee:asset_schema.name: DATASTRIP_ID
gee:asset_schema.description: Unique identifier of the datastrip Product Data Item (PDI)

gee:asset_schema.name: DATATAKE_IDENTIFIER
gee:asset_schema.description: Uniquely identifies a given Datatake. The ID contains the Sentinel-2 satellite, start date and time, absolute orbit number, and processing baseline.

gee:asset_schema.name: DATATAKE_TYPE
gee:asset_schema.description: MSI operation mode

gee:asset_schema.name: DEGRADED_MSI_DATA_PERCENTAGE
gee:asset_schema.description: Percentage of degraded MSI and ancillary data

gee:asset_schema.name: FORMAT_CORRECTNESS_FLAG
gee:asset_schema.description: Synthesis of the On-Line Quality Control (OLQC) checks performed at granule (Product_Syntax) and datastrip (Product Syntax and DS_Consistency) levels

gee:asset_schema.name: GENERAL_QUALITY_FLAG
gee:asset_schema.description: Synthesis of the OLQC checks performed at the datastrip level (Relative_Orbit_Number)

gee:asset_schema.name: GENERATION_TIME
gee:asset_schema.description: Product generation time

gee:asset_schema.name: GEOMETRIC_QUALITY_FLAG
gee:asset_schema.description: Synthesis of the OLQC checks performed at the datastrip level (Attitude_Quality_Indicator)

gee:asset_schema.name: GRANULE_ID
gee:asset_schema.description: Unique identifier of the granule PDI (PDI_ID)

gee:asset_schema.name: MGRS_TILE
gee:asset_schema.description: US-Military Grid Reference System (MGRS) tile

gee:asset_schema.name: PROCESSING_BASELINE
gee:asset_schema.description: Configuration baseline used at the time of the product generation in terms of processor software version and major Ground Image Processing Parameters (GIPP) version

gee:asset_schema.name: RADIOMETRIC_QUALITY_FLAG
gee:asset_schema.description: Based on the OLQC reports contained in the Datastrips/QI_DATA with RADIOMETRIC_QUALITY checklist name

gee:asset_schema.name: REFLECTANCE_CONVERSION_CORRECTION
gee:asset_schema.description: Earth-Sun distance correction factor

gee:asset_schema.name: SENSING_ORBIT_DIRECTION
gee:asset_schema.description: Imaging orbit direction

gee:asset_schema.name: SENSING_ORBIT_NUMBER
gee:asset_schema.description: Imaging orbit number

gee:asset_schema.name: SENSOR_QUALITY_FLAG
gee:asset_schema.description: Synthesis of the OLQC checks performed at granule (Missing_Lines, Corrupted_ISP, and Sensing_Time) and datastrip (Degraded_SAD and Datation_Model) levels

gee:asset_schema.name: SPACECRAFT_NAME
gee:asset_schema.description: Sentinel-2 spacecraft name: Sentinel-2A, Sentinel-2B

title: Sentinel-2 MSI: MultiSpectral Instrument, Level-1C
description:
Sentinel-2 is a wide-swath, high-resolution, multi-spectral
imaging mission supporting Copernicus Land Monitoring studies,
including the monitoring of vegetation, soil and water cover,
as well as observation of inland waterways and coastal areas.

The Sentinel-2 data contain 13 UINT16 spectral bands representing
TOA reflectance scaled by 10000. See the [Sentinel-2 User Handbook](https://sentinel.esa.int/documents/247904/685211/Sentinel-2_User_Handbook)
for details. In addition, three QA bands are present where one
(QA60) is a bitmask band with cloud mask information. For more
details, [see the full explanation of how cloud masks are computed.](https://sentinel.esa.int/web/sentinel/technical-guides/sentinel-2-msi/level-1c/cloud-masks)

Each Sentinel-2 product (zip archive) may contain multiple
granules. Each granule becomes a separate Earth Engine asset.
EE asset ids for Sentinel-2 assets have the following format:
COPERNICUS/S2/20151128T002653_20151128T102149_T56MNN. Here the
first numeric part represents the sensing date and time, the
second numeric part represents the product generation date and
time, and the final 6-character string is a unique granule identifier
indicating its UTM grid reference (see [MGRS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_Grid_Reference_System)).

For more details on Sentinel-2 radiometric resoltuon, [see this page](https://earth.esa.int/web/sentinel/user-guides/sentinel-2-msi/resolutions/radiometric).
